message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Iterator<Person> personIterator = persons.iterator();
while (personIterator.hasNext()) {
    Person person = personIterator.next();
    for (Volcano volcano : volcanos) {
        if (person.getXCoordPerson() == volcano.getXCoordVolcano()
                && person.getYCoordPerson() == volcano.getYCoordVolcano()
                && volcano.getEruptionStatus()) {
            personIterator.remove();
            break;
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an Iterator to traverse through the 'persons' list. The Iterator provides a 'remove' method which can be used to remove the current element from the underlying collection. In the nested loop, if a person is found to be on the same cell as an erupting volcano, the 'remove' method is called to remove that person from the 'persons' list. The 'break' statement is used to exit the inner loop once the person is removed.
